body.p: 1. Hananiah’s son; the father of Rephaiah and a descendant of David through Zerubbabel’s line, who lived in postexilic Palestine (1 Chr 3:21).
2. Jeduthun’s son and the leader of the eighth of 24 divisions of musicians trained for service in the sanctuary during David’s reign (1 Chr 25:3, 15).
3. Rehabiah’s son and one of the Levites in charge of the temple treasury during David’s reign (1 Chr 26:25).
4. Son of Athaliah from the house of Elam, who returned with Ezra to Judah following the Babylonian captivity (Ezr 8:7).
5. Levite of the family of Merari, who returned with Ezra to Jerusalem after the exile (Ezr 8:19).
6. Benjamite, Ithiel’s father, and an ancestor of Sallu. Sallu resettled in Jerusalem during the postexilic era (Neh 11:7).
